title_sort: william e. vandemark to walt whitman, 17 august 1863
title: William E. Vandemark to Walt Whitman, 17 August 1863
text: Dear friend witman[Whitman]I receive your letter [This letter is currently lost] yesterday and was glad to heer[hear] from yo[you] and yo[you] were en Joying good helth[health] as for me i[I] am not well my wound gans very slow the warm wether[weather] chafed me all to peces[pieces] and now with all the rest i[I] have got a large boil on my left knee my famly[family] is well my little girl has ben[been] quite sick but is well agen[again]—the wether[weather] has ben[been] very warm the hotest[hottest] that i[I] ever saw but yester-day it rained and to day it is cold enuf[enough] her to hafore[?] me thare[there] was a funeral here an infant 3 weeks old but i[I] could not tend the funeral—a nabor[neighbor] man of mine by the name of Felter Calder enlisted in the same ridgement[regiment] that i[I] did desurted[deserted] rite[right] after the fite[fight] at Gitiesburg[Gettysburg] and came horn and kep[keep] hid 3 weeks thare[there] is 30 dollars reward on him i[I] think they had or to hang him my furlow[furlough] runs out next thursday[Thursday] the 20 but I hante[haven't] able to come back i[I] have riten[written] to docter[doctor] blis[bliss] to have it extended i[I] wish that yo[you] would see him and tel him how it is if i[I] donte[don't] heer[hear] from him i[I] will come back Just as soon as i[I] am able and let me know what he says about the exstention[extension] I will close now good by from a friend and well wishes William E. Vandemark to Walt Whitman, 17 August 1863
